body.p: Lambda functions, also known as anonymous functions, are small, inline functions defined using the lambda keyword. Lambda functions are used to create small, one-line functions without a formal function definition. They are often used in situations where a function is needed for a short period of time.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: # Example of lambda function add = lambda x, y: x + y print(add(2, 3)) # Output: 5
